Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with -ac_ccactivate=<height>, it does do an automatic reindex (once)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and by default it enables addressindex and spentindex

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: adding or removing any index CLI option currently requires manual deletion of blockchain data and full resync, as far as I know

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
I've changed the relevant portion of the documentation to this:
```
The user should manually delete the blockchain data before initiating this parameter ===link to manual deletion instructions above===.
```
Let me know if you want something else.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: `Maintain a timestamp index for block hashes, used to query blocks hashes by a range of timestamps` for -timestampindex

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: `Maintain a full spent index, used to query the spending txid and input index for an outpoint` for -spentindex

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: ``timestampindex`` is a coin daemon parameter that instructs a KMD-based coin daemon to maintain a timestamp index for all blockhashes. It is initiated at run time and it is used to query blocks by a range of timestamps.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Bryan_Beus let me know what else you need, those come from src/init.cpp

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there is no -unspentindex

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Ah, okay

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that is basically addressindex

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
`    strUsage += HelpMessageOpt("-addressindex", strprintf(_("Maintain a full address index, used to query for the balance, txids and unspent outputs for addresses (default: %u)"), DEFAULT_ADDRESSINDEX));
`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that is what init.cpp says about addressindex

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: going from on to off, you can probably not do a resync as you wont notice its messed up, but the problem is if you turn it off and then back on. you would have a gap

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c there are recent BTC core commits to allow turning on and off, but I am not sure how easy it would be to merge

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and their code is specific to txindex, but maybe would apply to these indexes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: seems quite a big chance to do incremental stuff with indexes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: most people will just either have CC active and need the indexes or not

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oh, I realized a lot of the power of CC is because of the addressindex/spentindex existing!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: without it, many of the consensus things I am doing would be too slow

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and very few coins have these insight explorer based indexes built into the main codebase

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just one of those handy improvements that enabled some very powerful CC functions

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: even the simplest one, faucet, uses the addressindex

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Out of curiosity, should developers enable this by default on an asset chain that uses cc?

If so, maybe I should put a note in.

Content: they should, but I changed the default to be on for ac_cc chains

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442

Content: spentindex also

Content: k, but not `timestamp`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: gettransaction is often not what you want, getrawtransaction is usually what people want

Author: Vova Shevchyk#1106
Content:
Hi everybody. I have created a dice and now I am trying to make a det, But I can't

ubuntu@maven:~/src$ ./komodo-cli -ac_name=EE_CHAIN dicebet EE cd3a3c43cb1089729ca6ff4f517d359225865f0e83e5d5b85e6ca709869540c5 5 2
{
  "result": "error",
  "error": "cant find dice entropy inputs"
}


Can anybody help me to understand why do I get this error? üòÉ

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Hi @Vova Shevchyk ! Most probably it's because diceplan has nt enough UTXOs.
 Add some entropy txs by `diceaddfunds` and try place bet again

Author: Vova Shevchyk#1106
Content: Thanks @TonyL , that was my first though, I added some funds, but nothing changed. Do you know how many txs do I need exactly? I am playing in my net with my coin, so I don't have to much txs üòÉ

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: One `diceaddfunds` tx should be enough to place one bet in one block

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @Vova Shevchyk Was the `diceaddfunds` transaction mined?

Author: Vova Shevchyk#1106
Content: yeap... that's the issue üòÉ

Author: Vova Shevchyk#1106
Content: thanks

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: üëç `setgenerate true` will help I guess üòÉ

Author: Vova Shevchyk#1106
Content: what is that for?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Enabling mining so transactions should pass trough faster

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: `komodo-cli -ac_name=name setgenerate true`

Author: Vova Shevchyk#1106
Content: what is the difference to -gen?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: `-gen` enables mining on daemon start as komodod parameter, `setgenerate` enabling/disabling mining on fly (komodo-cli call). I just thought maybe your tx stucked because you not mining

Author: Vova Shevchyk#1106
Content: I see

Vova Shevchyk#1106
Content: üò≠

Author: Vova Shevchyk#1106
Content:
76a91488dc3c2e051ac56aa5112fba52dee94582d8456988ac script vs 2102726487c3f34fce704527c9a8e07d7bcc6f6f45f807ad18edb3a7621b746fdafbac (E) entropy vin.1 fundingPubKey mismatch ee0dbaad0bbd31b2ad5bde63aa61e723fb1a4bdab2a6dc76f371b5cd4b98d050
numentropy tx 3: 802.00000000
cant find dice entropy inputs

Author: Vova Shevchyk#1106
Content: looks like pubkey issue

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Aha, looks like

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Put as value of `pubkey=` with which you're starting daemon pubkey from `ac_name=name getaccountaddress ""` -> `ac_name=name  validateaddress addressfromprevcall` and try to gamble again üòÉ

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I think you'll need to re-create your diceplan

Author: Vova Shevchyk#1106
Content: I didn't understand üòÉ could explain

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
1) Call `ac_name=name getaccountaddress ""` to get wallet address
2) Call `ac_name=name  validateaddress %walletaddress%` to get the pubkey 
3) Use this pubkey for `pubkey=` parameter when starting AC daemon

Author: Vova Shevchyk#1106
Content: Now it's super clear, thanks. Will do that now

shame on me

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Oh, its not a shame - tricky thing)) Option with same pubkeys should work if you import same WIF to both wallets first by `importaddress`
